sentences.en: A confusing and disjointed story. Nice multiplayer options.
sentences.cn: 令人困惑和无法投入的故事剧情. 很棒的对战选项.

sentences.en: A lot of people in business , entrepreneurs especially, disjointed priorities.
sentences.cn: 许多人, 特别是创业者, 目的不明确.

sentences.en: Ardythe was still speaking as she had been earlier, her voice choked, the words disjointed.
sentences.cn: 阿黛丝仍象她先前那样诉说着, 声音哽咽, 话语断断续续.

sentences.en: Bottle Sickness: A temporary condition characterized by muted or disjointed fruit flavors.
sentences.cn: 瓶伤: 葡萄酒出现的暂时性状况如无生气或果味混乱.

sentences.en: But presently it began to flag a trifle , and grow disjointed.
sentences.cn: 但不久他们就开始泄气了,讲出的话前言不搭后语.

sentences.en: He gave a rather disjointed account of his experience in jungle.
sentences.cn: 在谈到他在热带丛林里的经历时,他的话前言不对后语.

sentences.en: He gave a rather disjointed account of his holiday.
sentences.cn: 在谈到他是如何度过自己的假期时,他的话前言不对后语.

sentences.en: He is rather disjointed when he ad-libs.
sentences.cn: 他即兴表演时，有些语无伦次。

sentences.en: His language is disjointed and sloppy.
sentences.cn: 他的语言支离破碎，混乱不堪。

sentences.en: Madge, therefore , uninterrupted, went on with the wild disjointed chat which her rambling imagination suggested.
sentences.cn: 而玛吉凭着她无拘无束的想象, 自由自在地继续扯谈些不相连贯的事情.

sentences.en: Most of these classes must be disjointed.
sentences.cn: 这些类别大部分是不相交的.

sentences.en: The fit between the country's information needs and its information media has become disastrously disjointed.
sentences.cn: 全国的信息需求与信息传播媒介之间的配置,出现了严重的不协调.

sentences.en: The old man disjointed his knee when he fell.
sentences.cn: 老人跌跤时把膝关节摔脱了臼.

words.tran_cn: 不连贯地；正常秩序被打乱了的

phrases.tran_cn: 不相交的集；互斥的集合；分离集

trans.tran_en: something, especially a speech or piece of writing, that is disjointed has parts that do not seem well connected or are not arranged well
